channel.title: If ur client doesnt open I CAN HELP!
channel.description:
Well if it comes up with all these lines like this
:: Port: :: 43594 :: Running using JDK 1.6.0_05... 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. :: Failed! Press any key to continue . . .
WELL U NEED TO SET UR [b]ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES[/b]
-So go to your computer
-Then click system information
-Then click advanced tab
-Then click Environment Variables
-Now if u already have a Classpath and a Path, You must edit it and if you dont have Classpath and Path you must add it.
-Your CLASSPATH should have something like this Classpath=c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to whatever version of jdk u have
- Your PATH should have something like this C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin
Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to whatever version of jdk u have
COMPILE and your CLIENT should load up perfectly :P
Rep me :)

item.title: If ur client doesnt open I CAN HELP!
item.dc:creator: @harveen harveen
item.description:
@harveen wrote:

Well if it comes up with all these lines like this

:: Port:
:: 43594
:: Running using JDK 1.6.0_05…
‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
:: Failed!
Press any key to continue . . .

WELL U NEED TO SET UR ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES

-So go to your computer

-Then click system information

-Then click advanced tab

-Then click Environment Variables

-Now if u already have a Classpath and a Path, You must edit it and if you dont have Classpath and Path you must add it.

-Your CLASSPATH should have something like this
Classpath=c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to whatever version of jdk u have

  • Your PATH should have something like this
    C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin

Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to whatever version of jdk u have

COMPILE and your CLIENT should load up perfectly

Rep me
